when_to_say: Used to express gratitude in informal settings.
example: ありがとう、助けてくれて！ (arigatou, tasukete kurete!) - Thank you for helping me!

when_to_say: Used to greet someone in the morning.
example: おはようございます！ (ohayou gozaimasu!) - Good morning!

when_to_say: Used to greet someone during the day.
example: こんにちは、元気ですか？ (konnichiwa, genki desu ka?) - Hello, how are you?

when_to_say: Used to greet someone in the evening.
example: こんばんは！ (konbanwa!) - Good evening!

when_to_say: Used to bid farewell, especially in formal settings.
example: さようなら、また会いましょう。 (sayounara, mata aimashou) - Goodbye, see you again.

when_to_say: Used to apologize or politely get someone's attention.
example: すみません、道を教えてください。 (sumimasen, michi o oshiete kudasai) - Excuse me, can you tell me the way?

when_to_say: Used to politely offer something or allow someone to proceed.
example: どうぞ、お座りください。 (douzo, osuwari kudasai) - Please, have a seat.

when_to_say: Used to politely make a request.
example: これをお願いします。 (kore o onegai shimasu) - Please, I would like this.

when_to_say: Used to affirm or agree with someone.
example: はい、わかりました。 (hai, wakarimashita) - Yes, I understand.

when_to_say: Used to negate or disagree with something.
example: いいえ、大丈夫です。 (iie, daijoubu desu) - No, it's okay.

when_to_say: Used to describe enjoyable activities or experiences.
example: 旅行はとても楽しいです！ (ryokou wa totemo tanoshii desu!) - The trip is very fun!

when_to_say: Used to describe something aesthetically pleasing.
example: この花は美しいです。 (kono hana wa utsukushii desu) - This flower is beautiful.

when_to_say: Used to describe speed or an early time.
example: 電車は早いです。 (densha wa hayai desu) - The train is fast.

when_to_say: Used to describe slowness or lateness.
example: 彼はいつも遅いです。 (kare wa itsumo osoi desu) - He is always late.

when_to_say: Used to describe large objects.
example: この建物はとても大きいです。 (kono tatemono wa totemo ookii desu) - This building is very big.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the act of studying.
example: 毎日勉強しています。 (mainichi benkyou shiteimasu) - I study every day.

when_to_say: Used to refer to eating.
example: 私は寿司を食べます。 (watashi wa sushi o tabemasu) - I eat sushi.

when_to_say: Used to refer to reading.
example: 本を読むのが好きです。 (hon o yomu no ga suki desu) - I like reading books.

when_to_say: Used to refer to writing.
example: 手紙を書きます。 (tegami o kakimasu) - I write a letter.

when_to_say: Used to refer to seeing or watching something.
example: 映画を見に行きます。 (eiga o mi ni ikimasu) - I will go to watch a movie.

when_to_say: Used to describe something new.
example: 新しい車を買いました。 (atarashii kuruma o kaimashita) - I bought a new car.

when_to_say: Used to describe something old.
example: この本は古いです。 (kono hon wa furui desu) - This book is old.

when_to_say: Used to describe something easy or simple.
example: この問題は簡単です。 (kono mondai wa kantan desu) - This problem is easy.

when_to_say: Used to describe something difficult.
example: この仕事は難しいです。 (kono shigoto wa muzukashii desu) - This work is difficult.

when_to_say: Used to describe speed or something fast.
example: 彼は速いランナーです。 (kare wa hayai rannā desu) - He is a fast runner.

when_to_say: Used to refer to doing something together.
example: 私たちは一緒に映画を見ます。 (watashitachi wa issho ni eiga o mimasu) - We will watch a movie together.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the current day.
example: 今日は忙しいです。 (kyou wa isogashii desu) - Today is busy.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the following day.
example: 明日会いましょう。 (ashita aimashou) - Let's meet tomorrow.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the previous day.
example: 昨日は楽しかったです。 (kinou wa tanoshikatta desu) - Yesterday was fun.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the present time.
example: 今は忙しいです。 (ima wa isogashii desu) - I am busy now.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a person.
example: あの人は優しいです。 (ano hito wa yasashii desu) - That person is kind.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a friend.
example: 私は友達と遊びます。 (watashi wa tomodachi to asobimasu) - I play with my friends.

when_to_say: Used to refer to family members.
example: 私の家族は五人です。 (watashi no kazoku wa gonin desu) - My family has five members.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a child.
example: 子供が公園で遊んでいます。 (kodomo ga kouen de asondeimasu) - The child is playing in the park.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a teacher.
example: 先生は優しいです。 (sensei wa yasashii desu) - The teacher is kind.

when_to_say: Used to refer to going somewhere.
example: 私は学校に行きます。 (watashi wa gakkou ni ikimasu) - I am going to school.

when_to_say: Used to refer to coming to a place.
example: 彼は私の家に来ます。 (kare wa watashi no ie ni kimasu) - He is coming to my house.

when_to_say: Used to refer to returning or going home.
example: 私は家に帰ります。 (watashi wa ie ni kaerimasu) - I am going home.

when_to_say: Used to refer to playing or having fun.
example: 公園で遊びましょう。 (kouen de asobimashou) - Let's play in the park.

when_to_say: Used to refer to working.
example: 彼は会社で働いています。 (kare wa kaisha de hataraiteimasu) - He works at a company.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a car.
example: 私は車を持っています。 (watashi wa kuruma o motteimasu) - I have a car.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a train.
example: 電車で通勤します。 (densha de tsuukin shimasu) - I commute by train.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a bus.
example: 私はバスで学校に行きます。 (watashi wa basu de gakkou ni ikimasu) - I go to school by bus.

when_to_say: Used to refer to an airplane.
example: 飛行機で旅行します。 (hikouki de ryokou shimasu) - I travel by airplane.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a bicycle.
example: 自転車で公園に行きます。 (jitensha de kouen ni ikimasu) - I go to the park by bicycle.

when_to_say: Used to refer to food.
example: 日本の食べ物が好きです。 (nihon no tabemono ga suki desu) - I like Japanese food.

when_to_say: Used to refer to drinks.
example: 飲み物をください。 (nomimono o kudasai) - Please give me a drink.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a meal or rice.
example: ご飯を食べました。 (gohan o tabemashita) - I ate a meal.

when_to_say: Used to refer to vegetables.
example: 野菜をたくさん食べます。 (yasai o takusan tabemasu) - I eat a lot of vegetables.

when_to_say: Used to refer to fruit.
example: 果物が好きです。 (kudamono ga suki desu) - I like fruit.
